column1: The diligences in France are very large
column2: and are divided into different compartments
column3: with a different price for each. There are usually three compartments below and one above. In the Italian diligences
column5: or at least in the one in which Mr. George and Rollo travelled to Rome
column6: there were only three. First there was the interior
column7: or the body of the coach proper. Directly before this was a compartment
column12: places for three persons on this seat. This front compartment is called the coupé. It is considered the best in the diligence.There is also a seat up above the coupé
column13: in a sort of second story
column14: as it were; and this was the seat which Mr. George and Rollo usually preferred
column16: where they could see better. But for the present journey Mr. George thought the high seat
column18: would not be quite safe; for though it was covered above with a sort of chaise top
column19: still it was open in front
column20: and thus more exposed to the night air.
